Event.name: Cause_bodily_experience
Event.definition:
<def-root>An <fen>Agent</fen> or <fen>Cause</fen> affects a <fen>Body_part</fen> of an <fen>Experiencer</fen> so that the quality of the <fen>Experiencer</fen>'s perceptual experience of the <fen>Body_part</fen> is qualitatively changed.
<ex><fex name="Agt">Chandra</fex> <t>massaged</t> <fex name="Body_part">Liliana's wrist</fex> <fex name="Explanation">because it was injured</fex>.</ex> <ex>Chandra <t>massaged</t> <fex name="Experiencer">Liliana</fex>'s wrist because it was injured.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Agent
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Agent</fen> is the person causing a bodily experience in the <fen>Experiencer</fen>.
</def-root>

Arg.name: Experiencer
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Experiencer</fen> is the being or entity whose experience changes.
<ex>Do n't <t>tickle</t> <fex name="Experiencer">me</fex> !</ex>
If the <fen>Experiencer</fen> is included in the phrase indicating <fen>Body_part</fen>, the <fen>Experiencer</fen> FE is tagged on a second FE layer.
<ex>Jolosa <t>scratched</t> <fex name="Vic">her</fex> back .</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Result
Arg.definition: <def-root><fen>Result</fen> identifies the result of the <fen>Agent</fen>'s action. </def-root>

Arg.name: Degree
Arg.definition:
<def-root><fen>Degree</fen> is the degree to which the <fen>Experiencer</fen>'s bodily experience is affected.
<ex>The wool <t>itched</t> <fex name="Degree">too much to wear it all the time</fex> .</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Manner
Arg.definition: <def-root>Any description of the event which is not covered by more specific FEs, including force (hard, softly), secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). It may indicate salient characteristics of an <fen>Agent</fen> that also affect the action (presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully). </def-root>

Arg.name: Means
Arg.definition: <def-root>An intentional action performed by the <fen>Agent</fen> that accomplishes the action indicated by the target. </def-root>

Arg.name: Place
Arg.definition:
<def-root><fen>Place</fen> identifies the place where the bodily experience is caused.
</def-root>

Arg.name: Time
Arg.definition:
<def-root><fen>Time</fen> identifies the time when the experience-causing event occurs.
</def-root>

Arg.name: Body_part
Arg.definition:
<def-root>>The <fen>Body_part</fen> identifies the location on the <fen>Experiencer</fen>'s body where the bodily experience takes place.
</def-root>

Arg.name: Instrument
Arg.definition:
<def-root>This FE is any object manipulated by the <fen>Agent</fen> to cause the experience.
<ex><t>Rub</t> the sore muscles down <fex name="Instrument">with the oil provided</fex> .</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Purpose
Arg.definition: <def-root><fen>Purpose</fen> identifies the state-of-affairs that an <fen>Agent</fen> hopes to bring about by causing an experience in the <fen>Experiencer</fen>. </def-root>

Arg.name: Depictive
Arg.definition:
<def-root><fen>Depictive</fen> identifies any <fen>Depictive</fen> phrase describing the actor of an action or the affected entity.
</def-root>

Arg.name: Containing_event
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the event within which the bodily experience is caused.</def-root>

Arg.name: Explanation
Arg.definition: <def-root>A fact or action somehow related to the <fen>Experiencer</fen> that the <fen>Agent</fen> responds to by causing an experience in the <fen>Experiencer</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Iterations
Arg.definition: <def-root><fen>Iterations</fen> refers to the number of times the <fen>Agent</fen> or <fen>Cause</fen> causes an experience. </def-root>

Arg.name: Cause
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Cause</fen> marks expressions that indicate some non-intentional, typically non-human, force that affects the <fen>Experiencer</fen>'s <fen>Body_part</fen>.
<ex><fex name="Cause">The coat</fex> <t>chafed</t> a bit .</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Subregion_bodypart
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Subregion_bodypart</fen> defines the precise location on the <fen>Body_part</fen> in which the experience occurs. </def-root>

Arg.name: Circumstances
Arg.definition: <def-root>Circumstances describe the state of the world (at a particular time and place) which is specifically independent of the causal event and any of its participants. </def-root>

Arg.name: Frequency
Arg.definition: <def-root>How often the Cause_bodily_experience event occurs.</def-root>

Arg.name: Duration
Arg.definition: <def-root>Duration denotes the length of time from the beginning of the Cause_bodily_experience event to its end. </def-root>

Arg.name: Particular_iteration
Arg.definition:
<def-root>This FE indicates that the Cause_bodily_experience event is conceived as embedded within an iterated series of similar events or states.
<ex>Her sweater was <t>itching</t> her <fex name="Particular_iteration">again</fex> .</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Concessive
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE signifies that the state of affairs expressed by the main clause (containing the Cause_bodily_experience event) occurs or holds, and something other than that state of affairs would be expected given the state of affairs in the concessive clause.</def-root>

Arg.name: Re-encoding
Arg.definition:
<def-root>A description presenting a separate aspect of the experience-causing event.
<ex><fex name="Re-encoding">In a serious breach of decorum</fex> , he <t>rubbed</t> Merkel 's shoulders .</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Period_of_iterations
Arg.definition: <def-root>The length of time from when the Cause_bodily_experience event began to be repeated to when it stopped.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: itch.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: cause an uncomfortable bodily sensation that makes one wish to scratch

lexUnit.name: scratch.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: relieve an unpleasant bodily sensation by minor abrasion of the surface of the skin, often with fingernails.

lexUnit.name: tickle.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: cause to experience a sensation that generates amusement and/or uncontrollable movement away from the stimulus by light physical contact.

lexUnit.name: rub.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: apply deep pressure to muscles and/or joints to bring relief from soreness.

lexUnit.name: massage.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: apply pressure to muscles and/or joints to relieve pain or soreness.

lexUnit.name: chafe.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: rub unpleasantly, causing to experience a feeling of constriction.

lexUnit.name: hurt.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to cause pain in a body part
